FuncDef:
The nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist auto-lock enable command enables a device to automatically lock IP addresses in a NAT blacklist.
The undo nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist auto-lock enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device is disabled from automatically locking IP addresses in a NAT blacklist.
CLIs: undo nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist auto-lock enable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a NAT blacklist is configured and its automatic lock function is enabled, once a device detects traffic matching entries in the blacklist, the device locks the IP address listed in the blacklist. As a result, users assigned the locked IP address cannot get online, and new users are not assigned this IP address.
Prerequisites
The reverse first-packet blacklist function has been enabled using the undo nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist disable command.
Precautions
The automatically locked IP address must be the one contained in the blacklist. When the IP address is being locked, the device does not advertise a blackhole route destined for the IP address.
This command is mutually exclusive with the nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command.
The nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist auto-lock enable command takes effect only on the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
